content: Granted, Alabama’s concern is not the fate of those “non-Bama teams” in the TaxSlayer and Belk Bowls. It’s their own upcoming game, for which the Tide are favored by more than two touchdowns. Washington quarterback Jake Browning is no Purdue transfer, though, and both Deshaun Watson and J.T. Barrett in a potential final would pose tougher challenges than Alabama’s relatively vulnerable secondary has had to face in months.
